title: China: Freedom on the Net 2023 Country Report | Freedom House
content:
# Freedom on the Net 2023: China Country Report

Freedom House's comprehensive assessment of internet freedom in China for the period June 2022 to May 2023.

## Overall Score: 9/100 (Not Free)

China scored 9 out of 100 points, placing it among the world's most repressive internet environments alongside Cuba and North Korea.

## Score Breakdown
- Obstacles to Access: 22/25
- Limits on Content: 12/35 (most restrictive category)
- Violations of User Rights: 24/40

## Key Findings on Content Moderation

### The Great Firewall
- Blocks approximately 300,000 domains
- Blocks all major Western platforms: Google, YouTube, Facebook, Twitter/X, Instagram, Wikipedia (Chinese version), BBC, NYT
- Uses Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) technology

### AI-Driven Censorship
- Real-time algorithmic moderation on domestic platforms (Weibo, WeChat, Douyin/TikTok)
- AI systems scan billions of posts daily
- Keyword blacklists: 10,000+ terms including "Tiananmen Square 1989", "Xinjiang genocide", "Winnie the Pooh" (Xi proxy)
- NLP models detect synonyms, pinyin variants, emoji proxies

### Platform-Level Enforcement
- Weibo: Deletes 10M+ posts/year; 90% flagged preemptively by AI
- WeChat: Scans chats for sensitive keywords; ~300M+ messages monitored daily
- Douyin: Uses content security algorithms; indirectly bans LGBTQ+ terms
- Real-name registration mandatory on all platforms

### Major Censorship Events (2022-2023)
- COVID-19 Lockdown Protests: "A4 paper" protest videos scrubbed within hours
- Taiwan Elections: Coverage suppressed; VPN usage surged
- Economic Criticism: Discussions of Evergrande property crisis censored
- White Paper Protests: Anti-lockdown demonstrations erased online

### VPN and Circumvention
- Unapproved VPNs illegal; users face fines (up to Â¥15,000 or ~$2,000) or detention
- Apple removed 1,779+ VPN apps from China App Store
- Government-approved VPNs exist but are slow and monitored

### Surveillance Integration
- 1 billion+ surveillance cameras with facial recognition
- Integrated with Alipay/WeChat for tracking
- Social credit system penalizes dissent
- ~1 million censors employed nationwide

## Trends
- China's score declined from 10/100 in 2022, driven by intensified protest censorship
- Global export of censorship model via Belt & Road digital initiatives
- Influence over 80+ countries through surveillance technology and frameworks

## Methodology
- Expert assessments
- Local partner reports
- Media monitoring
- Academic research (Citizen Lab, Oxford Internet Institute)
